website_summaries.verdict: Samsonite quality in a hardside design. You won't find a better deal with more to offer.
pros: Organization pockets make it easy to compartmentalize
cons: Not scratch resistant, especially if you put it through a lot of heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for JetBlue's 22x14x9 and other baggage sizers! Love it
customer_reviews.author: Liz E.

customer_reviews.title: Wheel broke after after a few months, loose threads everywhere
customer_reviews.text: The wheel broke after a few short months (see attached photo), and I kept finding loose threads in the luggage. The warranty is very problematic - either ship it yourself (at your own expense), or find a store that will ship it for you (not so common - might be hours away). And even then, it can take many weeks for them to return it. I expected a much better quality from the Samsonite brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Y.B.

customer_reviews.title: please read the negative reviews also before buying this product!
customer_reviews.text: just used the product with 20 kilos and the handle is broken, can't get up.......ugs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke on my first trip!
customer_reviews.text: The luggage is nice and seems to look the part, but on my very first trip the zipped completed shredded and broke apart. I found my self trying to get back to the car with a suitcase full not being able to zip. Not what I was expecting and very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage product.
customer_reviews.text: Product and support are absolute garbage. I thought the other reviews were exaggerations, so I purchased this luggage set. First trip using the luggage both zippers break on the 28" piece. I contact customer support and get a response saying I will need to pay shipping to get their broken suitcase back to them and possibly repaired. What a joke. I will never again buy a Samsonite product and neither should you.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second used - not happy
customer_reviews.text: zipper broke on second use. This sucks !!! Looked up how to return and the "window for returns" was 29 days. WHAT ???? Now I'm stuck with expensive luggage that is defective. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: SeriousShopping

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The Zipper on the Large one broke after 1st trip
customer_reviews.author: Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with product warranty
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with product warranty. Purchase 4 bags in February 2017, 11 months ago. All have had light , if any use, to date. The zipper of one, which had very light use, only 2 overnight car trips, is opening (failing) without cause. And while it corrects itself, when reclosing the zipper, it happens again, without warning or cause: thus, not reliable. Called Samsonite customer service, explained situation, and told that I must ship it to one of their repair centers, to distant states, which is not only very burdensome, but costly, particularly in view of a replacement of only $80 or so! Very, very disappointed that Samsonite would not rectify their faulty product (or loss) equitably.
customer_reviews.author: robert blake

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, zipper broke. I had the zipper replaced. The second time I used it, the handle got stuck even my dad can’t push it back. This is the first time I use this brand and I’m surprise how bad the quality is.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Wang

customer_reviews.title: Zipper split mid first trip
customer_reviews.text: The bag didn't even last one trip. I had to pay to get it wrapped just to make it home because the zipper split.
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the airline business and I travel a lot. I was using a suitcase made for flight crews but it was heavy. I packed a week's worth of clothes for a trip to Iceland and when placed on the airport scale, the whole package weight 28lbs! I ordered the charcoal gray but orange would have been OK too. The gray color is easier to spot now among the sea of black suitcases on the carousel! The only negative is there is no outboard strap to attach a briefcase, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, light weight, and easy to roll. I needed a big and sturdy luggage for our family travel to Europe. We rented a car in Europe for a month. This fits perfectly for our rent car Volvo wagon. Three of this size of luggages fit in the trunk. If I purchased 28 inch, I would regret because. 24 inch is perfect for handling and fitting into the rent car. It isn't over weight for the flight too! For the 28 inch luggage, it's easy to be charged over-weight fee.
customer_reviews.author: HYEJEONG SHIN

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at lack of quality for the brand.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this suitcase is lightweight and so easy to maneuver. The quality is very poor I've only used it 3 times and the zipper is broken. I've never over stuffed it which still wouldn't be a reason for it to break. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Stotko

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, wheel suck
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this piece of luggage. I bought in December for trip to Iceland, after that trip the wheels have been terrible. Suitcase does not roll as nice as other ones that I have. They get stuck and just can't handle either the weight or the day to day usage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: The luggages came with a lot of dust. The weels were used and no cover bag. I bought them cause I got to the ones ordered by a relative and felt in love, however I am totally disappointed with mines as they came in a bad condition, unfortunately I could not change as I traveled the next day. To make it worst the luggage pusher didn't make one trip. The pusher is no longer working 😡😡😡😡😡. Just wasted my money 💰
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Luggage for International Traveling
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for myself and my boyfriend for our recent trip to Italy for 12 days. These bags fit the American Airlines International Flight Requirements.. I was quite surprised that I was able to fit many different outfit options in this suitcase by strategically packing using packing cubes. This luggage was very durable and I love the zippered sides inside the bag. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is not the Samsonite of the past
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. This luggage is flimsy and retractable handle is wobbly feels like it will break soon. I have used this luggage once and the first thing I noticed is the retractable handle does not like to stay extended. It retracts if the luggage goes over a bump. And no, I am not gripping the handle with my hand over the button. The luggage does not roll well over any surface that is not utterly smooth. I hope this luggage survives my trip to Europe, I feel I have wasted my money. My mother had a set of Samsonite luggage that lasted for decades, not this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Code Slinger

customer_reviews.title: I love the color - I bought the orange - it ...
customer_reviews.text: One trip so far - 3 weeks in Italy - lots of hauling over cobble stones and rough sidewalks. No problems at all with the spinners. I love the color - I bought the orange - it certainly stands out. My main complaint is the way it opens - others have said the same thing. It opens right down the middle so a) You have to be careful of things spilling out and b) It's difficult to prop open. Other than that, perhaps it could use a few pockets on the inside but still, very sturdy and easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Sitkin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My daughter took this on one flight to Florida and the case came out of baggage totally dented
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gathering Dust and Scratched Out of the Gate
customer_reviews.text: Scratched before I even left the house. How bogus is that? Also the shiny surface gathers statically charged dust and pet hair--you name it--immediately. Just sitting there. I even wiped it off and stood it up by itself. Then a few minutes later--boom! Dust. Why should I have to wipe off my luggage all the time? Can't return it as we are travelling to New Zealand very soon. My wife bought textured luggage by Merack (?) Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke after a single use
customer_reviews.text: Took ONE trip to Ireland and when I returned the zipper had already broken. I had high hopes for this set of luggage, but was extremely let down when the zipper broke.
customer_reviews.author: Boger Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: A great suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these and have traveled with them several times since purchasing. Both domestically and overseas. They have held up well, though a couple gouges have emerged from rough treatment while in airline hands. The 24" size is about perfect because you can really stuff it and still stay under the 50lb weight restrictions without much worry. As others have noted, the orange color makes it easy to spot when it comes along on the baggage claim belt. The suitcase is very light and rolls great. We really like the internal divider that separates the two halves. If anything happens to these, I will absolutely buy new ones.
customer_reviews.author: D. Desborough

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SUITCASE IF YOU WANT A WORKING LOCK
customer_reviews.text: The lock on this suitcase broke on the very 1st flight ! When I got this suitcase, I set the combination to my desired choice using provided instructions and reset button as indicated in the instructions. When I claimed the bag, the lock was unlocked and I discovered it was broken and it will now open for every combination. You can no longer depress the reset button. There are no signs of anyone forcing it open, so it is simply a poor quality locking system.
customer_reviews.author: David Howson

customer_reviews.title: This is great luggage for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is great luggage for the price! It is easy to wheel and packs well (lots of internal space). My son took this to Europe and he had to go a number of places, and this was easy to move. The measurements were perfect for several airlines, and the orange color stood out in the baggage claim area. I would absolutely buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: our contents were well protected with zippers & wheels holding up nicely. The locking mechanism provides good security too
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight but does the job. Our travel is mostly cruises and car trips, so we chose the hard side over the fabric. After 2 cruises, our contents were well protected with zippers & wheels holding up nicely. The locking mechanism provides good security too. Very easy to roll, but the carry on doesn't stack well on top of the other two. The polycarbonate finish scratches & gouges relatively easily, so factor that in to your buying decision. For us, the set was an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: JDFla

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke, it won’t stay zipped
customer_reviews.text: I went ahead and invested in these because I thought they would be durable. I’ve only had them a little over a year and used them to fly a handful of times. I’ve not traveled much since I got them because of a pregnancy and infant. I noticed while on holiday that the zipper is broken, when you zip it up it then comes open. So this expensive bag is now worthless. So I would not suggest these because they aren’t that durable. I used to travel a lot more with cheaper luggage and it held up better. I’m really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M_C

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I took this piece of luggage on two trips and the zipper has already broke and I'm now incapable of using it again. Samsonite, what happened to your life-long quality? My return window has closed, now what?
customer_reviews.author: torrie

customer_reviews.title: Unemotional Baggage
customer_reviews.text: I own Samsonite baggage. My girlfriend owns Samsonite baggage. My sister owns Samsonite baggage. My girlfriend's sister owns Samsonite baggage. My point is, these are amazing, unemotional baggage. No stress, no worry, no fear. The wheels on these are still going round and round after I went round and round the world. Super light weight. Doesn't weigh you down like other baggage. Highly Recommended! Maneuverability 5/5 ***** Light Weight 5/5 ***** Durability 5/5 ***** My Recommendation 5/5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Mid size perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I already had the 20" carry on and the 28" full size..Booth awesome,lightweight pieces. I always check bags for the travel I do and they have held up well for the two+ years of use. The only issue I had was a handle broke on the 28" but easily found and made a replacement. This purchase was to get a mid size bag as it turns out the full size is too big for many of my shorter trips and the 20" isn't good for anything over a day or two. This is the perfect size and the "grain" print on the orange color was beautiful and unexpected!
customer_reviews.author: David C. Logothetis

customer_reviews.title: Read! Color!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One dark blue and one black. The dark blue was an “open box” but about $30 cheaper so why not try? It actually came brand new BUT the color was a slate grey. My son doesn’t care about the difference in color and glad I purchased it at a steal. But, this is why they seem to have a huge amount of the brand new but “open box”. Usually for an open box they will have 1-2 and those truly are damaged In some way or their packaging is damaged. These open box aren’t damaged (brand new) but they are a different color other than dark-ish blue!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Easy to pull around the airport
customer_reviews.text: I've had both the 28” and the 20” version for over two years now. They've both held up fantastically and still look great. The 20” one is the maximum size allowed for carry-on and has fit in every overhead bin I've tried it in. It does not expand like the two larger versions. It's easy to pull around the airport and fits a surprising amount of stuff considering its diminutive size.
customer_reviews.author: XytheX

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Samsonite will not stand by their so-called warranty
customer_reviews.text: The zipper broke after a few trips, and Samsonite would not even look at it. They said it is simply a matter of wear and tear. Their so-called warranty is simply a matter of denying any and all claims. This happened with 2 different suitcases we bought. Do yourself a big favor and buy your suitcase from a manufacturer with better ethics and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Groover

customer_reviews.title: No Expansion Zip as advertised in photos!
customer_reviews.text: On the photos of this product it shows expansion zip. When I received it there was no expansion zip. It was absolutely useless to me without the expansion as it was too small. I was refused a refund. Absolute joke!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best luggage I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, LOVE this luggage set! The color truly is the deep purple, with a glossy finish. True to what others have stated, the glossy finish allows for the scuff marks to show, but it ALSO makes it easy to wipe the marks off. The pieces are lightweight and very spacious. I was able to pack for a 10 day International trip and only had to use ONE bag (the largest). The swivel wheels make it easy to maneuver. I especially like that I didn't have to lean and pull the luggage, as it rolls smoothly standing straight up. I waited and watched for quite a while before making this purchase and it was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: A solid set of suitcases
customer_reviews.text: I received this set of luggage as a graduation gift. I take long-haul flights at least once a year, with shorter flights and trips in between. This luggage set fits enough for my cross-continent moves as well as being useful for short business trips. The largest luggage back is technically larger than airlines allow, however I have yet to be told it is too large. It's within two inches and I don't think all airline carriers care that much.
customer_reviews.author: Nehema

customer_reviews.title: Prefer a fabric Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for a recent trip. I wouldn't have picked it for myself, as I prefer a fabric suitcase. It is surprisingly light, and rolls quite easily. BUT, because the zipper is placed at exactly the midpoint of the suitcase, unless you use the strap to contain your clothes everything will come spilling out. Also there is no outside pocket to stash last minute items or zippered pockets inside. Even though it is plenty roomy for a week's worth of clothes, because it is a hard plastic it will not expand at all.
customer_reviews.author: Saskia

customer_reviews.title: Not enough support unless you pack it full
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 28" in orange. Loved the color because it was extremely easy to spot in the baggage carousel and that is about all I can say good about this piece of luggage. This thing is huge and if you fill it you can plan to pay they extra baggage fees for being over 50 lbs. And if you don't fill it, then it doesn't have enough support and wants to 'cave in' where it zips together. After just one trip it is more beat up than my previous suitcase that I've had for 10+ years. I can't imagine this suitcase surviving multiple trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R.

customer_reviews.title: I Guess it's Fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought it mainly for the Samsonite name.....my old Sams piece that I am throwing away lasted 45 years. It's a little tough to rate new luggage........one hasn't used it yet, so it hasn't withstood any test of time. It looks great, but surface looks like it will scratch easily. But, that's OK, I didn't but it to put it in a beauty pageant, as the airlines will massacre almost any piece at their discretion. Med fits into the large for E Z storage. Locks are plastic. Zippers look sturdy. Has all the features that I wanted, I am not a frequent traveler, will only use it 3-4 times per year. Sooooo, check back with me in 4-5 years, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Serria

customer_reviews.title: Durable and quality suitcase for all travel
customer_reviews.text: I regularly fly international and have taken this suitcase from the US through the middle east and into very rough airports in Africa and it performs flawlessly. One of my other brand bags busted and dented in while going through the Mozambique airport, but this held up strong and did not dent or break anywhere. Great quality and worth spending more to get this suitcase as opposed to the cheaper ones that dent in when flying international.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: These suitcases were not durable...
customer_reviews.text: After nine months of use, these suitcases look terrible. They pick up marks from everything! These suitcases have not endured any more abuse than any other suitcase I've owned (let's be real-- checked bags aren't exactly treated like they're made of glass) and they look like they are ready for the dumpster after less than a year. I would not buy these particular bags again, and it's possible that I will never again purchase another piece of Samsonite luggage. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great luggage, bad wheels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set a year ago. I really like the luggage, but the wheels don't last. When new they glide easily, but then the wear sets in and you have to drag the bag instead of pushing it. The wheels don't have bearings, they just ride on the axle. Fortunately I found these replacement wheels: amazon.com/gp/product/B07R97RT1J/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Now it's back to as it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: All you need for a frequent traveler
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite suitcase I think I have ever owned. The single zipper 4 wheel roller bag is harder to find than one might think. The compartments are easy to use and a basic model of what you need when you are someone who travels a lot. It's light weight but durable. Doesn't scratch easily which is nice for someone with OCD like myself. I've been on small planes and it always fits as well which is really important to me so I don't have to gate side check. The price is right as well. I haven't had any problems with any of the hardware and the lock works well.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Replaced after 5 years of rugged wear and tear - great product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best hard case suitcases I have ever used. I had one that I used weekly for about 5 years. I recently replaced because of the wheels not rolling as smooth as it did when brand new. It had taken quite a beating from the different airlines over the years. By far the most durable suitcase out there. I had bought another brand that was supposed to be top notch and elite luggage. Well with in 3 trips, one wheel was broken off. So I went back to the tried and true Samsonite brand. You cant go wrong with this is you need a durable easy to use suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Palecek

customer_reviews.title: Zippers work, locks work good packaging
customer_reviews.text: Honest review! They look amazing, well packaged and carefully delivered. Zippers and lock work great, no problems with the zippers or the locks as others have reported. Pull handel and wheels work smoothly. One trip from Chicago to Napa California and the bags are all scuffed up along the edges. I will say they went from looking beautiful to looking like I owned them for 10 years with one single use. Other then the cosmetics, they still perform so I'm still happy. With that I'm still careful with zipping them closed. Other then the cosmetics, I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ratatattatt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because of Samsonite's reputation. Unfortunately, the wheel broke with less than 5 months use. If you are looking for something that lasts, avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Far too big & heavy
customer_reviews.text: This case is absolutely huge; weighs more than you want it to (a good bit of your kg allowance will be taken up by the weight of the case itself) and it gets shredded every time you use it. To be fair this entire range of Samsonite cases (i've got a carry on which I prefer) are prone to getting scratched by aggressive gusts of wind but there's nothing you can do about that. I would suggest you get the smaller size of this case though; I'm having such regret about buying this size.
customer_reviews.author: Niki-Jay

customer_reviews.title: Best carry on I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Samsonite Winfield carry on. Bought one for myself about a year ago and just picked this one up for my daughter. She's a slight little lady and this is SO lightweight that even she can lift it when it's full. The colors are great (we have an orange and a teal one), even though they will scuff up. Best part is I can fit everything I need in it for several days and I am a huge overpacker! And I've yet to find an overhead bin that this doesn't slide into with ease! It's small but mighty.
customer_reviews.author: ~Ali~

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up under normal use
customer_reviews.text: PROS - the luggage is beautiful and easy to handle. CONS - the luggage is not well-made. During first use the Samsonite emblem fell off. After 4 domestic trips (2 were car trips) and 1 international trip the luggage literally cracked!! There were no extreme weather temperatures and rough handling, or over stuffing that could have contributed to this malfunction. It was purchased less that two years ago. I do not know how to reach the seller to ask about the "lifetime" satisfaction guarantee supposedly offered by Samsonite.
customer_reviews.author: Halli

customer_reviews.title: "Hardside" is a Misnomer
customer_reviews.text: These were a Christmas gift for my daughter who is going to Europe in the spring. I was looking for rugged hardshell luggage that could withstand luggage handlers. The Samsonite Winfield doesn't appear to be able to handle that. The "hard side" is a misnomer because the shell material is very thin and flimsy. Looks like one good toss and landing on the corner and it will be ruined. Lastly, the color said it was teal and it's not even close. It looks more like a dark blue-green. I returned these and purchased a Cool Life set that was cheaper, more rugged, and true to color.
customer_reviews.author: wayne71

customer_reviews.title: One Trip Down, Good to Go
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the purple and orange for our recent trip. I had done research on hard vs soft and I'm glad we decided on the hardside case by Samsonite. Pros: -Space! I love the two sided compartments and sock/underwear compartments on inner sleeve. -Colors are really beautiful out the box -Wheels roll smooth -Popout handle seems stronger than my past suitcases -TSA lock works perfectly fine Cons: -Beautiful paint probably won't last long. After one trip its already showing scratches, gouges and chips in it's paint. Overall, we're very satisfied after their first trip. Hopefully they'll continue to last!
customer_reviews.author: Sean S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a week's travel to Europe
customer_reviews.text: The largest American suitcases are too big to fit on many European buses, trains, etc. This size was perfect for a week-long trip to Europe. I put clothes on one side, and non-clothes (electricity converter, books, make-up, medications, etc.) on the other side. The light weight is helpful when trying to stay under that 50 lb. limit. Expansion was very helpful on return--it's generously sized. I love Samsonite quality. Very glad I purchased from this seller. Top notch product, very good customer service/support/contact. Will use this hardside luggage again and again.
customer_reviews.author: jnmvanc

customer_reviews.title: Ok product, not great, not bad
customer_reviews.text: luggage is ok, not as nice as some directly from the Samsonite store locally. Given the price however compared to the local store this is a good alternative. Be careful of the fulfillment company while I might consider the product again based on the price point, I will not order from the same fulfillment company- check them out on BBB before placing your order.
customer_reviews.author: hardgarrison

customer_reviews.title: Great Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Took it on about 4-5 trips. It held up fine besides some minor scratches. I love the fact that you can expand it and the wheels feel much sturdier than any other spinner I had. Update after 10-15 Trips I travel a lot for work and need a reliable bag that will not break every 2-3 trips. I have taken this bag with on about 13 trips now and it still looks new. I love the glossy finish. It did not fade over time but has minor scratches. I’m surprised there’s no cracks or dents from the way these airlines throw your bags around. It’s definitely worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good and stable
customer_reviews.text: After being on a few flights and a cruise, these cases still look great. Nothing inside was damaged. They roll along quite well on regular flooring and fairly well on industrial carpeting. No problems balancing them on escalators or moving walkways. Really liked the multiple heights that you can set the handle at when traveling. Easy to use zippers and the internal dividers seem well designed. Really pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Carry-on, times 3
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Samsonite Winfield 2 Hardside luggage for years (carry-on, medium, and large sizes) and absolutely love them. I bought this blue one for my 13 year old daughter, and another gray one for me (since my 14 year old son commandeered my original carry-on in pale gray), and we are all delighted with the looks and functionality of this luggage. It’s easy to use (pulling, swerving around people at the airport, etc), durable, and has TSA-approved locks. It’s the perfect carry-on size and is hardsided so it will better protect fragile items (makeup, even a large porcelain doll). Better prices at Amazon than any other places I’ve searched.
customer_reviews.author: Reader & Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Plastic broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase broke after one use. I contacted the seller for return, that was an able to return it due to the size, and I did not have a box that it would fit in. To have a faulty product like this, I’m not investing any more money to get this back to the seller. They should’ve just refunded me for an item in this size. Very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yoklo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the Zippers
customer_reviews.text: We used this carry-on for our annual vacation. The teeth on the zipper do not mesh together easily, and the suitcase kept opening. This is not something you want to have to think about and keep checking while you are traveling. The retractable handle also kept getting stuck half-way up/down, and took several tries to either pull out all the way or fully retract all the way. We were VERY disappointed in the suitcase, and expected better from a well-known brand like Samsonite.
customer_reviews.author: Shana Chaffer

customer_reviews.title: I loved the first one so much
customer_reviews.text: This was the second one we bought. I loved the first one so much, I got one for my husband for our trip to Italy. It was the perfect size and fit on all the trains. Super sturdy too! It made it miles and miles being drug along old cobblestone roads in Venice and Florence. It's still going strong too!!! Great purchase at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren5560Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: strength
customer_reviews.text: I have used soft side suitcases for awhile but airlines have a tendency to mercilessly beat up bags so felt I should move to a stronger frame. This suitcase suits me just fine for that purpose. I have a smaller version of this model but found it was just too small for my purposes so purchased this one. Very roomy....
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. Red

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a horrible purchase. I bought the "brushed Anthracite" 3 piece set and upon opening I was beyond disappointed. All 3 pieces had multiple dings/scratches on them and the glossy finish/varnish appeared to have been peeled or cut out?
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to international travel
customer_reviews.text: I dragged these across cobblestone streets, subjecting them to abuse because I have no choice: I pull two of these at one time, both loaded with bags on top. So I don't have patience to take curbs slowly. I just pound the pavement. I will say that the surface has scuffed a little more than I imagined, but that is irrelevant. The shell holds up and the wheels are great. Make sure you get a good idea of the dimensions. We were a little suprised by the smallness of the medium sized bag, but in the end it ended up being perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Apollinaire

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this suitcase so far! We are going on a trip for three days and packed for the two of us accordingly. We unzipped the expander and still have plenty of room for anything we pick up on the trip. The suitcase arrived without any dents, with lock instructions, and with protective plastic on the sides. It weighs about 11 lbs by itself so keep that in mind when packing if your airline has a weight limit for checked bags! It rolls very well on uneven concrete and regular flooring. The handle works perfectly too. I will update this review after our trip to report on how the wheels are holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Christon

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to handle, value for money.
customer_reviews.text: These are durable and lightweight. Been using them for almost two years now. This set of three is a great value for money. I also got them during thanksgiving and got a great discount on them too. I travel quite a bit and over my multiple trips, they have held their own after all the flight luggage handling abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Panda

customer_reviews.title: it is more like 63-64 linear inches instead of 62 (including wheels and ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is misdescribed: it is more like 63-64 linear inches instead of 62 (including wheels and handle, which is how airlines measure it). I never had to pay extra though - it was never measured at a checkin counter. The bag surface scratches easily but it rolls ok so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Vinogradov

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase until it broke
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome lightweight suitcase until it broke. Under two years and maybe six uses and where the zipper attaches to the suitcase is already coming apart. Worst part is there are no local repair shops and I have to drive over an hour to drop it off at a authorized store and pay to get it shipped.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The best suitcase
customer_reviews.text: This is the best suitcase I have ever known. I researched a lot of suitcases before I pulled the trigger and I am SO glad I picked this one. The color is awesome, it maneuvers wonderfully and fits plenty of clothes for a 2 week trip. I also bought the large and both the med and large were enough space for me and my 2 kids including diapers and wipes and toys for a 2 week trip. The hard shell (the exterior) of the suitcase got scratched by TSA because they were checked. Its annoying that they were scratched during our first trip, however that happens with any luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: So pretty I almost didn't want to use
customer_reviews.text: These suitcases are beautiful. I almost didn't want to use them, because I knew they would get totally scraped up by baggage handlers (and I was right, they did--scraped and scuffed ☹️). They are very roomy and are separated into compartments that make it easy to separate and secure your belongings. Everything stayed put inside even after one trip with two plane changes. I haven't needed it yet, but it's nice to know I have that extra couple of inches of expandable space just in case. The wheels are very maneuverable and the retracting handle is easy to use. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Curly

customer_reviews.title: You do get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed! This suitcase is beautiful, scratch resistant, and fit perfectly in the overhead compartment on both an American 737 and A-321. It rolls easily and is more Omni-directional than other carry on bags I have used. I travel a lot, so this bag will come in handy! Although a bit expensive, it is well worth the money and comes with a great Samsonite guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Mihalis in Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for a little over a year now. It's been checked to Qatar, Thailand, Italy, France, Spain and all across the US. Although I was skittish about paying for a hard case it was the best decision. Sure, the pretty, glossy shell has some scuffs but it's held up extremely well. It does get searched by TSA A LOT but I have no idea why. The swivel wheels are great. The inner divider is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas R. Holladay

customer_reviews.title: Zippers split easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 pieces of the Samsonite luggage for a recent trip to Hawaii. The bags are extremely lightweight and very pretty. The wheels worked well even when fully packed. Unfortunately, the zippers are not sturdy and broke several times while packing and unpacking. The teeth split and the zippers became stuck several times. I was very nervous upon our departure that the zippers would give way mid-transit bursting all over the airport. If the zippers held up I would give these bags 5 stars but cannot do so since the zipper is an integral part of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P.

customer_reviews.title: Pushing, pulling is such a breeze. One full carry on, on top and it was like it was empty.
customer_reviews.text: Just took the middle size one on a week vacation and it was perfect. If I was planning on buying a lot then I probably would have just used the larger one. It did get scuffed but that’s expected from the airlines but other then that it was perfect. It was so nice just putting my carry on (lug bag) used this time on top of my suitcase and just push it with like one finger literally outside, through the airport, etc. so easy to handle. I hope that they continue to be as great going forward, but I believe they will.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Great set of luggage!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived over a week late, and the shell was damaged. There's a tear in the shell that's visible along the bottom in the closeup. I tried pressing on it from the inside to get it to pop back out but even with my full weight, it won't bounce back. Filed for return within 30 minutes of item delivery. I will revise my review once this is resolved, but they're stating that the item is now out of stock and that they have no idea when more will be available. How did this even happen? Edit: Amazon made it right!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Murray

customer_reviews.title: Looks sharp and has plenty of space!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a replacement to his very old soft side suitcase. I am very happy with the amount of space for the size of the suitcase. My husband didn't want to move up to a 27" or 28" suitcase, but he wanted to have enough room to pack for a week. This suitcase has tons of room on both sides when opened up! The finish on the outside is also very nice looking and will make the suitcase very easy to identify on the carousel even though it is the slate gray color.
customer_reviews.author: Moosegirl67

customer_reviews.title: Do. Not. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is the SECOND one I’ve purchased! I’ve had the same issue. After a few months of use, the handle comes out of line and will not extend or gets stuck fully extended. I’ve had the second for just over 2 months (Dec 8, 2019) and missed the return window by <3 weeks. 😡 Total garbage. Do. Not. Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Hall

customer_reviews.title: BEST luggage I've EVER had!
customer_reviews.text: I move around every few years (country to country) and also travel extensively for work and for leisure, and this suitcase ABSOLUTELY holds up! My husband bought a set a few years ago and loved it so much he convinced me to buy a set as well. The wheels show no significant wear despite nearly monthly use, and aside from superficial scratches on the outside the case is extremely durable. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B.

customer_reviews.title: Overall amazing
customer_reviews.text: As we have only to unpack them, I can say they arrived as expected. Box was fully branded and labeled so if that is in issue for you please take note. The actual luggage was immaculate. Packed in cloth bags and nested so as to take minimal space in previously mentioned delivery box. The zippers and stitching all appear to be well done and the wheels handle great even with a full load. Will be putting the set to the test several times this year and will be sure to update once we have some actual mileage on the set.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Autry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I am an occasional traveler for work. I was tired of purchasing cloth or leather luggage because the first time I used it would tear or get marked up from the rough handling at the airports. I decided to purchase this Samsonite hard side suitcase because I got a pretty good deal on it and I liked the options of color. I have now traveled with it at least a dozen times and it still looks new. There are a few minor marks on it, but nothing I can't buff out if I really wanted to. I am so pleased with this purchase that I am going to purchase another one today.
customer_reviews.author: IdaO

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: 64” linear - I measured myself. Classified as Oversized and subject to fees on EACH Flight.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Bought the suitcase as new from the Amazon Warehouse for about $90. Arrived quickly and in new condition. I bought the Winfield 2 charcoal gray color in a 28" spinner. It's beautiful with a 10 year limited warranty. Wanted a suitcase made our of polycarbonate rather than ABS since it is supposed to be more durable and flex instead of cracking if under attack. Also has the TSA lock of course that they can open so I can lock it to others. Also expandable with dual zippers. Will put some decals on it to help me quickly ID it at the luggage carousel.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Luggage Set
customer_reviews.text: The biggest one was a lot bigger than I was thinking, but no complaints of it being bigger. I did see the measurements, but once having it in hand instead of a picture helped to see how big it is. It rolls easily both empty and full with weight. I think the quality is nice and I like how it comes with different pieces as well. One time you may need a big one and one time you may need a smaller one. With 3 sizes coming with the set, it was nice instead of having to buy a big one and then a small one because in the end you could be spending more. Overall, happy with the items
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Z

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase at the end of October and it looked great. I opened it up and checked the locks and it looked good. Just went to use it for the first time and discovered the zipper side is zipped closed with no pulls to open it. Maybe the zipper was installed inside out. Is there anything that can be done. I own the larger size case and it is very nice. I am so upset that I did not notice the lack of zipper pulls when I checked it out. The only way to use it now will be to try to split the zipper but then there will be no way to zip it back up.
customer_reviews.author: A Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I splurged (for me) and bought this suitcase for a cross-country trip. It was great. I wish it was a little lighter, but it's large so I guess that's to be expected. It was so beautiful I hated the thought of it being thrown around by the airlines and getting scratched up. I almost cried when I turned it over baggage check, knowing it wouldn't be the same when I got it back. As expected, I came home with it scratched but that's not the company's fault. It's a beautiful blue color, very sturdy and has a cool lock. I couldn't recommend another suitcase higher than I would this one. Beautiful finish and extremely well-made. It's my favorite one ever.
customer_reviews.author: April from NC

customer_reviews.title: Very  happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these bags. After two transatlantic flights, two international flights, one train trip, a ferry trip across the Baltic and various other tram, bus and subway trips, I have to say that they have held up beautifully. They did suffer scuffing and are not as pretty as they were (and they were REALLY pretty) but they kept all of our things secure and the scuffs can be buffed. We loved the expandable feature. We started out without expanding and as we acquired items, we were able to expand them. They roll beautifully. I am very pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Frank

customer_reviews.title: The suitcase was damaged on the first trip. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase was damaged on the first trip. The name tag was ripped of and the suitcase was badly scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Paloma

customer_reviews.title: Great Suitcase - awful color
customer_reviews.text: We traveled to the west coast during a time when the temps ranges from 50-75 daily. I needed pants and shorts every day and this was just the right size. The spinner wheels are really awesome. I'm dinging it one star because the color was really poorly represented in the photo. I ordered Winefield color which appears like a dark plum in the photo. What I got was a very bright Royal purple. I dislike the color so much I would have sent it back. Unfortunately I had paid for overnight shipping and we were traveling in the morning. Just an FYI, I'm a photographer so my monitor is calibrated regularly. The problem is not my monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: I ordered Samsonite Luggage Winfield 2 Fashion HS Spinner 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Samsonite Luggage Winfield 2 Fashion HS Spinner 20, Orange, One Size In the description it is mentioned; - Body Dimensions: 20.0" x 13.5" x 9.5" - Expands for added packing capacity.Overall Dimensions: 23.0" x 14.5" x 9.5" But it is not expandable!!!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case
customer_reviews.text: This is the second suit case in the set I have purchased. They are awesome. You can't miss them coming off the luggage carousel. They hold up nicely to air travel and hold a lot. It rolls nicely and the handle tucks away securely. I got the large size the first time and it was just too big. This one was just perfect for a single person on week long trips or two people for a weekend.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Check your airline carry-on restrictions before taking the 20" onboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the luggage. However, because of the wheels, the 20" "carry-on" had to be checked because of the wheels. Had the wheels been removable or retractable, the 20" would have made it as a carry-on. (Total linear for American is 45", 22"H, 14"W, and 9"D). The height of the 20" is 22.4", the width is 13.8", and the depth is 9". The height was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D.

customer_reviews.title: Bag tips over  when shifting from hard to carpeted surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this suitcase. It tips if you are wheeling it on all 4 wheels and hit any sort of friction, such as a transition from a hard floor to a carpeted surface. I'm glad that I purchased it as part of Amazon Prime day and got a good discount but I still chose to use my old banged up Samsonite Xion Spinner over this case. It also scratches very easily.
customer_reviews.author: SarahA

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sturdy easy to travel cases
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE CASES!!!! Used them for two international trips and a cruise already. The colour (I got purple) is soooio rich and beautiful and easy to spot on the carousel. I love that they also come with protective bags for each case so i dont have to worry about scratches during storage . They also hold WAY more than a standard suitcase and are lightweight. Just know that if you fill the large one to capacity it will most likely be overweight (>50lbs). They aren't scratch proof but the scratches are minor and some can even be rubbed out if you have the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love These - Have Bought Multiple Sets.
customer_reviews.text: We travel A LOT and have used Samsonite Winfield suitcases for years. Our growing family means we've bought more. Our first set is now 6 years old and still going strong (they're scuffed and covered in luggage stickers, but still work). These are significantly lighter than fabric suitcases of the same size so we can pack more and still be within airline weight restrictions. They are very durable - the wheels, zippers and locks have lasted for 6 years at >100,000 airline miles/year. The set of different sizes allows you to pick a case that fits the trip - small for a weekend/overnight and the large one for big trips.
customer_reviews.author: PB&J

customer_reviews.title: I would LOVE to discuss what to do next with the seller
customer_reviews.text: First trip and the zipper on the large bag has separated and cannot br repaired properly because the origin of it is covered. I would LOVE to discuss what to do next with the seller!!
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline Camillo

customer_reviews.title: it is easily scraped and scratched up very quickly by airline and ...
customer_reviews.text: Based on one round trip between West and East coasts the bag has done what it is supposed to do. However, it is easily scraped and scratched up very quickly by airline and TSA personnel. This is our second Samsonite which uses the combination center TSA accessible lock and two non key lockable locks on each end. We did pick the color so it is easier to see on the luggage convey belts.
customer_reviews.author: 3P072A

customer_reviews.title: I DO NOT WANT TO GIVE A ONE STAR
customer_reviews.text: I USES 2 TIMES LARGE LUGGAGE ZIPPER BROKEN. I CAN NOT RETURN ALSO!!!!! IF YOU WANT TO BUY THIS ONE, JUST USE CAERFUL "LIKE A BABY ZIPPER"
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this piece of luggage. I ordered the 20" and 24". Holds a lot more than I thought it would. It is easy to spot if checked. The 24" was scuffed up some at the bottom because it was checked but it is not really noticeable. Both pieces came with a cover to put over them when not in use. Directions came with both pieces to set a new code for the TSA locks. It did take me a little bit to get the hang of it but once I did one piece the second was a snap.
customer_reviews.author: B Morris

customer_reviews.title: Weak considering the brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have a higher end Samsonite that I love and use weekly. I know this one was a lower end piece, but I expected better durability. Wheel came off after less than a month and only 2 trips. Handle is far looser than it should be when extended. For reference, my colleague has the same piece that feels much more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Good carry on case
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great suitcase. It meets the dimensions of a carry-on which makes it my go-to bag for air travel. It is very roomy, even without the expanding zipper some of the bigger models have. I use this with packing cubes and I have been able to fit about 5 days worth of travel needs along with souvenirs into it. It moves easily in the airport and seems durable. If I had one gripe it would be that the pop up handle is not the sturdiest, but it functions as intended so I am not docking this product's score.
customer_reviews.author: T-Lex

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous blue color
customer_reviews.text: I cannot really review on durability yet as they are only sitting in my closet at this time. They are very sturdy in appearance. They seem very roomy and straps and zippers to hold things in place. The set of 3 fit inside each other so that saves a lot of room. Once i use them i will place another review but i do like them. I have ordered another one in the Rose Gold waiting on arrival today. Will be back with more reviews !!
customer_reviews.author: jjrn

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are too small and catch on every imperfection in the floor
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of this suitcase. The wheels seem too small for the suitcase. When full it was not easy to direct across carpeted areas in the terminal. It would also catch on every tiny imperfection in the floor or rock on the floor and fall over. Opening the area that adds to the width of the suitcase made it worse. Maybe the catching on the floor is true of other suitcases but I think larger wheels would help on the larger versions of the suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Just the Facts

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new suitcase. This one has obviously been used before. It's beat up on the outside and stained on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Martin

product_meta.title: Samsonite Winfield 2 Hardside Expandable Luggage with Spinner Wheels, Charcoal, Checked-Large 28-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Checked-Large 28-Inch| Color:CharcoalTransport your travel essentials effortlessly and stylishly. This extremely lightweight and durable spinner features 100 percentage polycarbonate construction with sharp molded details. Made to absorb impact by flexing while under stress then popping back to its original shape, eliminating dents and dings while protecting its contents. An elegant brushed pattern hides any potential scratches or scuffs from your journeys. The fully-lined interior has cross-straps, a privacy curtain with its own zippered organizational pockets. Tsa approved combination lock for security and peace of mind. Beautiful brush-stroke coloration which is great for hiding any potential scratches or scuffs from your journeys.
feature_bullets: 28" SPINNER LUGGAGE maximizes your packing power and is the ideal checked bag for longer trips
PACKING Dimensions: 28.0" x 19.75" x 12.5", OVERALL Dimensions: 31.0" x 20.0" x 12.75", Weight: 11.5 lbs.

10 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY: Samsonite products are rigorously tested to ensure our products meet stringent standards. This bag comes with a 10-year warranty against defects in materials and workmanship.
FOUR, MULTI-DIRECTIONAL SPINNER WHEELS for effortless mobility, re-engineered lightweight
SIDE-MOUNTED TSA LOCKs act to deter theft, ensuring that only you or a TSA agent have easy access to your belongings when traveling
1.5" EXPANSION to allow you to pack more items and compression keeps clothing neatly pressed
UNIFIED BRUSHED PATTERN CUSTOM DESIGN on front and back shells hide any potential scratches or scuffs from your journey
HANDSOME SLIDER in squared full-capacity design featuring oversized #10 zipper and interior divider with organization pockets

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,299 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
